definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: I want some more of your dynamite stewed beef, please.
sentences.chinese: 請再給我一些你們那種美味可口的燉牛肉。

sentences.english: The horseradish has to be fresh for its taste to be delicate enough.
sentences.chinese: 需使用新鮮的辣根，以確保它在烹飪後美味可口。

sentences.english: Some even say preserved pork tastes more delicious than fresh meat.
sentences.chinese: 一些人甚至說，臘肉比新鮮豬肉喫起來還要美味可口。

sentences.english: Children enjoy pizza because it's fun to eat and delicious.
sentences.chinese: 兒童喜歡喫比薩，因爲它喫起來好玩又美味可口。

sentences.english: Pineapple is one of summer's most popular fruits simply because it's so delicious.
sentences.chinese: 菠蘿由於美味可口而成爲夏天最受歡迎的水果之一。

sentences.english: Especially it's head part are the best of the tasting, people love it.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是鱅魚的頭部美味可口，最讓人喜愛。

sentences.english: Fruits are very delicious and make us healthy.
sentences.chinese: 水果非常美味可口，益於我們健康。

sentences.english: We ate the food all up because they are really good.
sentences.chinese: 我們把食物都喫的清光因爲它們真的很美味可口。

definition: to smell, look and taste great
to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
